result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody J. Alexander

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea and Sentencing held on 8/7/14 before Judge Weston (kept in 14CF237)
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF211, 14CF227, 14CF237, 14CM165 & 14CM233 called together at 10:40 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Cody J. Alexander in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF211 & 14CF227:Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Alexander waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information
; Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #1-14CM233, Count #1-14CM165, Count #2, #6 & #10-14CF211 and Count #1-14CF227; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2-14CM233, Counts #3, #4, #5, #6, #7, #8, #9 & #11-14CF211, Count #2-14CF227 and case 14CF237
Sentencing arguments by ADA Hall; Statement by Jennifer Muckleroy; Sentencing Arguments by Atty Svehlek

On Count #1-14CM233, Count #1-14CM165, Count #2, #6 & #10-14CF211 and Count #1-14CF227, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 2 months in Jefferson County Jail (on Ct#2-14CF211), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence forthwith
--Mental Health Evaluation and follow-through with all recommended treatment
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment 
--Participate in educational program if recommended by Agent
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--May reside with Jennifer Muckleroy if she allows him to do so, she or Agent may revoke that privilege at any point in time
--To pay restitution of $47.97 payable to Fort Atkinson Shopko
--To pay restitution of $8.16, payable to Fort Atkinson Pick-n-Save
--To pay costs of $243 (14CM233)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CM233)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CM233)
--To pay costs of $243 (14CM165)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CM165)
--To pay $100 domestic abuse surcharge (14CM165)
--To pay costs of $268 (14CF227)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF227)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF227)
--To pay costs of $754 (14CF211-$268-Ct#1, $243-Cts 6 & 10)
--To pay $650 DNA Surcharge (14CF211- $250-Ct#1, $200-Cts 6 & 10)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF211)
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee

Court presents concerns and indicates that those concerns may be addressed through Anger Management, but does not specifically order this *note on JOC*
Court orders that all costs/fees still owing at the end of probation be reduced to civil judgment rather than extend probation

Days credit for time already served: 2 days - 14CM165
Days credit for time already served: 0 days - 14CM233
Days credit for time already served: 32 days - 14CF211 - Ct#2
Days credit for time already served: 1 day - 14CF227

Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Court presents basis and grants expungement on 14CF211 & 14CF227, upon successful completion of probation and if during the course of his probation he commits no new crimes. Petition must be submitted, upon completion of probation. 
Recess: 11:29 am

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF211, #14CF227, #14CF237, #14CM165, #14CM223 called at 9:44am.
Defendant Cody J. Alexander in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that she hopes to have a second Pretrial Conference informally tomorrow with ADA Hall, and then she is asking that Plea/Sentencing Hearing be scheduled for later this week. 
recess 9:46am


NEXT:  schedule all five files for Plea/Sentencing on Thursday, August 7th at 10:30am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF237 and #14CM165 called at 10:15am. 
Defendant Cody J. Alexander appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek appears in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek indicates that the State has provided a global offer on Mr. Alexander's cases; she requests that these two cases be set next week, when Mr. Alexander's other cases are already on the calendar for August 5th at 9:30am. 
recess 10:17am 


NEXT: schedule these cases for Plea/Sentencing next Tuesday, August 5th at 9:30am  (JA-- please note in comments for case #14CF237 that the case is still at Prelim stage)

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 8:20am. 
Defendant Cody J. Alexander in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Arguments given on the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond. 
The Court denies the Motion.  The $500 cash bond requirement and conditions remain in effect.
recess 8:29am.
Status conference on July 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
of the Defendant to Modify Bond

[Clerk KG]
Case called at 1:17 pm.  

Defendant Cody J. Alexander in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited.
Court has reviewed the Criminal Complaint and finds that it states Probable Cause to support Counts #1 and #2.

Court requires $500 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No presence at any Walmart store
-Comply with all bond conditions in existing files

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties. 

Recess: 1:28 pm

NEXT: 
Schedule Status with 14CM165 for 7-29-14 at 10:00 am
(Clerk notes that the Court informs Public Service Special Prosecutor Attorney Melanie Flint the date and time of the Pre-Trial Conference is to be scheduled by the parties.)
